dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fancy party is in progress. The butler, a large man nam some punch from a bowl into a glass as THE COUNTESS, a sn long cigarette holder and a monocle, looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it rather odd that your mistress hasn't  put in an appearance at her own party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands her the punch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes, Madame. I'm sorry, Madame. The Countess walks off with disdain. The butler shoots a room. We follow his gaze with a FAST PAN TO the man of th a rather mousy gentlemen who sits worriedly in a chair. H stands over him, smoking a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?  Rumsford pounds his fist into his hand and rises abruptly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is that wife of mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, take it easy, Rumsford. Williams arrives with a tray of drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink, sir? Rumsford and York each take a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Williams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Mrs. Rumsford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word, sir. I'm terribly upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're upset.  What about me? She invites all  these people to her birthday party and then  runs out on them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always does that, sir.  She'll probably be  back in a day or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chokes on his drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day or two?! Williams makes a face and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snap out of it, Rumsford. You must make  allowances for her youth. Sherry'll turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't love that woman so much, I swear  I'd-- A car horn HONKS. Rumsford and York stare in horror as an into the living room and SCREECHES to a halt in front of guests GASP in amazement. At the wheel of the car is the and vivacious SHERRY RUMSFORD, wearing a hat and a fur co husband and starts to climb out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, darling!  Hello!  Be right over!  Williams enters and stares in shock at the car. SHERRY (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Williams! Williams regains his composure and stands at attention. WILLIAMS (with some resignation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Madame. Sherry takes off her fur coat while Rumsford and York exc She throws her fur coat across the room at Williams and i drapes itself goofily around his shoulders. She takes off it onto Williams' head. He looks rather ridiculous in a l but bears the humiliation with dignity. Meanwhile, Rumsfo RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, York. You're a doctor and you're my  best friend. Isn't there anything you can do  for her? DR. YORK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid she's a bit out of my line. The men  you want are Doctors Ziller, Zeller, and  Zoller. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they can help her? DR. YORK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're the finest psychiatrists in the  business. They're terribly expensive and their  methods are very peculiar. But they do get  results. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have Williams call them. I'll have  Williams call them immediately. Rumsford rings for the butler. York checks his watch. DR. YORK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to see a patient, Rummy. I'll try to  get back later. Good luck. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. York exits as Williams approaches. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Williams. I want you to telephone Doctors  Ziller, Zeller, and Zoller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painted onto the glass of the office's front door, a sign Dr. Z. ZILLER, M.D. Dr. X. ZELLER, M.D. Dr. Y. ZOLLER, M.D.

dialogues.speaker: ENTER
dialogues.text: We PAN from the door to reveal a PAINTER cleaning up his cans, brushes, etc.) and a SECRETARY who struggles with a telephone switchboard. SECRETARY (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this switchboard! The secretary holds the headphone to her ear as she tries SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's dead! Frustrated, she throws the headphone down and turns to th SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank goodness you're through. I've been almost  crazy. PAINTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. I'll have my stuff out right after  lunch. The secretary exits into a private office as the painter door. Immediately, the Three Stooges enter from the front CURLY. Moe carries a tool box. Curly carries a huge ladde LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like there's nobody here. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the place all right. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I got the-- Curly turns to look around and SMASHES the glass of the f ladder. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You puddin'-head!  Why don't you look what  you're doin'? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help it. I was lookin' around to see  if there's anybody in the office and when I  turned-- Curly turns and SMASHES a glass water cooler with the lad MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you did! CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Curly turns to look at the smashed water cooler and the l and POPS Moe in the face. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Moe clutches his eye in pain. He advances on Curly. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you be careful? Moe pokes Curly in the eye. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop that ladder before you hurt somebody. Curly DROPS the ladder on Moe's foot. Moe clutches his fo MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to tear out your Adam's apple. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a note of it. As Curly reaches into his pocket, the secretary returns a they've made. Curly, with a tiny pencil and pad, makes a remind Moe to tear out his Adam's apple. MOE (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that! Moe grabs the pencil away from Curly. Curly squeals and p from his pocket and starts to write with it. Moe grabs th MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? Curly makes a few noises of frustration and then pulls a from his jacket and starts to write. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk. Moe grabs the pencil and HITS Curly over the head with it CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! You'll break my pencil! MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll break your head. Moe pulls a hair out of Curly's chest and Curly squeals i secretary joins them. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, what war is this? MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind the wisecracks, Toots. We're  trouble-shooters from the phone company. What's  wrong here? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painters ruined my switchboard. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. The Stooges move to the switchboard. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can bring it to life and a call comes in  for the doctors, say they're out of town. I'm  goin' to lunch. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. As the secretary exits, Curly calls after her. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Bring me back a piece of burnt toast and a  rotten egg! LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnt toast and a rotten egg? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got a tapeworm and that's good enough  for 'im. MOE (pushes Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!  Get busy! The Stooges get to work. Curly sees a stethoscope in a do switchboard. He pulls it out and puts the earpieces in hi MOE (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she comin'? LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so good. Curly puts the stethoscope against the switchboard. CURLY (to the switchboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, "Ahh!" MOE (to Curly, off the stethoscope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got here? Moe pulls on the stethoscope, stretching it out. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, gimme that! Gimme that!   Moe releases the stethoscope -- it snaps back and WHACKS CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh! Moe violently pulls the earpieces from Curly's ears, caus Curly GNASHES his teeth pneumatically at Moe who hands th to him. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, go on! Get busy like I told ya!  (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on! Moe shoos Larry away from the board, sits, and puts on th puts a phone wire up to a hole in the board. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull this line through and hook it on number  six. Curly pulls the line through the hole in the board -- but attached to the headphones on Moe's head, thus causing Mo pulled forward violently. Moe's head SMASHES into the boa MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Moe pulls his head back, drawing the wire backwards. This who squeals and pulls on it again -- too hard. He stumble of the scene.  There is a huge CRASH.  Moe and Larry jump QUICKLY TO Curly sitting in a bucket amidst the painter's his hands stuck in a paint can and a wooden plank on his CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woo-woo. Woo-hoo-hoo. Hey, Larry!  Help me!   I'm surrounded! Woo-hoo-hoo! Moe and Larry rush to Curly's aid. They push the plank aw grabbing an arm, lift Curly to his feet. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.  (to Larry, off the bucket wedged onto Curly's rear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a hold o' that! Moe grabs Curly by the head and Larry pulls the bucket of Larry FALLS to the floor in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Williams is on the phone, making a call. WILLIAMS (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know it's out of order. I've been trying  for half an hour to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stooges stand together and confer. MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you, puddin'-head? You  been actin' slug-nutty all day. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gertie. She's gonna have-- Curly grows suddenly bashful.  But Moe realizes what he m MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful. When do you expect it? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any minute. That's why I'm so upset. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No foolin'? Why didn't you tell us? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you see, I-- LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You're broke. CURLY (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flat as a floogie. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bad. We gotta figure out a way to get  some money and get it quick. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thanks, Moe. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Moe and Curly shake hands. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I got-- Moe looks down in disgust at his hand, now stained with p Moe wipes his hand on Curly's jacket. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Curly barks like a dog. Moe CONKS Curly in the back of th MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Get to work! The Stooges head back to the switchboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Williams is still on the phone. WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Operator, you must get that number. Now,  try again, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry struggles with some phone wires.  Frustrated, he wh LARRY (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh... Miraculously, the wire lodges in the proper hole: a light board starts to BUZZ. The Stooges rush to the board and M MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Operator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Susquehanna two-two-two-two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOE (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toot-toot-toot-toot? What do you think you're  doin' -- playin' trains? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh! I love to play trains!   (imitates a train)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choo choo choo choo choo! Whooo-woo! Sssssssh! MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get a toupee with some brains in  it? Moe THWACKS Curly's nose. Curly pulls up Moe's bangs and forehead. MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you--! Moe turns his attention to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Doctor Ziller, Zeller, or  Zoller. This is an important case. We'll pay  any price if they'll come over immediately.  Money is no object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOE (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be there in a flash in the flesh! Moe hangs up and addresses Larry and Curly. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need money and I got a way to get it. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to do? MOE (points to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Ziller.  (points to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Zeller.  (grandly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Doctor Zoller. CURLY (shakes Moe's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, glad to meetcha, Doctor. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are ya, son? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen, Doc. I'm troubled with T.S. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, T.S.? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Stomachs! MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick out yer tongue! Curly sticks out his tongue. Moe PUNCHES him in one of hi MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an impatient patient waiting. Come on. Although they protest, Moe grabs Curly by the ear and Lar drags them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry comes running out of the building, followed by Rum A chauffeur waits beside a fancy car (license number 5R 1 RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Sherry, you can't run out on your guests  like this again. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, darling, I'm bored! I'm only going for a  short ride in a submarine! I'll be back in a  day or two. Tell them all to wait. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Sh-- They are interrupted by the gentle RINGING of bicycle bel dressed in top hats and tails -- come riding up on a thre They fall off the bike at the edge of the driveway -- to confusion of the Rumsfords. The Stooges rise and rush ove RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm Mr. Rumsford. Are you looking  for someone? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ziller. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Zeller. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Zoller. As Sherry looks on with interest, Moe puts a shoe horn ne MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick out yer tongue. Rumsford opens his mouth and Moe uses the shoe horn as a MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, "Ahh" with your mouth closed. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. LARRY (singing in harmony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. MOE & CURLY (joining in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. ALL THREE STOOGES (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...  (spoken, with disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rats! MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, gentlemen. It's strictly a case  of latkes and [pippiks?] Sherry roars with laughter at the Stooges. SHERRY (practically squealing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is priceless. RUMSFORD (to the Stooges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the patient. It's Mrs. Rumsford. The chauffeur looks on with amazement as the Stooges turn CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. How do you do, Madame? RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, see here, Sherry... SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, darling, you take the submarine ride. I  wouldn't leave these men on a bet. Come,  gentlemen! The last one in is a Republican! Sherry suddenly bolts for the front door.  The Stooges ta pursuit, with Curly circling Rumsford like an airplane be after her.  A stunned Rumsford quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry runs in, followed closely by the Stooges. Moe plow upsetting the tray of pretzels he carries and knocking hi Sherry laughs gaily throughout.  After a moment, there is woman's SHRIEK. Sherry and the Stooges turn to look at th Williams now lies in the Countess' lap beside a mustached Everyone is covered with pretzels. John has the pretzel b WILLIAMS (totally mortified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Countess. I'm so sorry. The Countess has a pretzel wedged around her eye like a m her own monocle up to the other eye, trying to keep her d THE COUNTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really! Sherry hurries over to help straighten things up. SHERRY (to guest with lid on his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, John! Rumsford rushes in and joins the Stooges.  He sees the me RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh! Sherry starts to take the lid off John's head. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a drink. She removes the lid but his toupee comes off with it, lea ping pong ball.  He clutches his head in horror.  A distr confers with the Stooges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, what will I do with her? Now, let me  tell you a little bit about Sherry. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't bother. I'll take Scotch. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make mine rye. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take gin smothered in bourbon. Nyuk, nyuk. MOE (to Larry and Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys. Moe motions with eyes and head to something o.s.  They fo stare at each other for a split second before racing away over to a table loaded with drinks.  Sherry stands at the drink. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, do have some rum punch. Sherry leaves with the drink and a tray of hors d'oeuvres CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rum punch? Why, soitanly. Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk,  nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Curly removes his gloves. Larry pulls the stethoscope fro LARRY (off the stethoscope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this thing would come in handy. Larry removes the earpieces from the stethoscope, leaving tubing.  Moe watches as Larry offers one of the earpiece LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join me? The business end of the stethoscope is dropped into the b CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soitanly. Skoal. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skoal. Using the tubing as a tandem drinking straw, Larry and Cu the rum punch.  After a moment, they stop and make faces. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weak. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The rum went through this punch on  stilts. Moe takes a bottle from the table, opens it and takes a w MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Scotch ought to help. LARRY (picking up another bottle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gin should make it fizzy. CURLY (with two bottles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bourbon and rum ought to help some. Curly sniffs one of the bottles.  He sneezes twice and is again when Sherry returns to the table and offers him a t SHERRY (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hors d'oeuvre? CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Hay fever. Sherry busts out laughing at this and walks off.  The Sto various bottles into the punch bowl.  When these are empt some other bottles on the table. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, here's some new kind of liquor.  Wor-cester-shire!  (pours Worcestershire sauce into the punch bowl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ho ho ho. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This says "Tabasco" -- I ain't never drunk any.  But we'll put it in.  MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got to lose? Larry pours hot Tabasco sauce into the bowl.  Curly squea hands with delight as he finds a bottle of his own. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk.  Sham paynee! Curly POPS the cork on his champagne bottle.  The cork fl champagne SPRITZES out of the top.  Curly covers the bott stop the flow.  After a pause he looks over at Moe and do We SWISH PAN TO discover Moe with the champagne cork wedg Moe grimaces, pulls the cork from his eye, stares at it f down, and confronts Curly. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't handle dangerous weapons.  (off the champagne bottle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not! MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have it! CURLY (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh... Curly removes his hand and the foam SPRAYS Moe.  Curly di champagne into the punch bowl while Moe BOPS Curly's head succession.  Larry calls Moe's attention to the punch bow LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  It's boiling. The punch is practically steaming. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be done. The Stooges grab little glass cups and dip them into the their glasses together and all three drink simultaneously they wince horribly and belch PUFFS of smoke from their m down their glasses and wipe their mouths, looking rather LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A marvelous accomplishment. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prodigious achievement. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it! It's putrid! Suddenly, Rumsford joins the Stooges at the table. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, would you be good enough to look my  wife over now? MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. The Stooges follow Rumsford to the sofa where Sherry and talking. RUMSFORD (to Sherry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor's going to look you over, dear. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, goody. Curly joins Sherry and the Countess on the sofa, sitting and Larry stand nearby. MOE (to Sherry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, uh, we shall test your reflex first. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Doctor. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Sherry's legs are crossed and Curly taps her just below t reflexes. But nothing happens.  Sherry just laughs. Curly frustration and taps her again.  Still nothing.  Curly sq face. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the way a normal reflex should act. To demonstrate, Curly crosses his own legs and taps himse Nothing.  He does a double take and scowls at Sherry.  No the Countess sitting beside him and taps her knee, still THE COUNTESS (offended, to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. Delighted with Curly's boldness, Sherry gasps and puts a CURLY (to the Countess)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't have to apologize. You can't help  it you're crazy. The Countess is so shocked by this remark that the monocl eye. MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere, guinea pig.  Curly rises, sits on the arm of the sofa, and crosses his beside him and prepares to show him how it's done. (Meanw other guests, including the Countess, start tapping thems knee.) MOE (professorially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, then. Holding the palm at a forty-five  degree angle... Moe taps Curly below the knee.  Nothing happens.  MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be off a couple of degrees. Moe tries again.  Still nothing. MOE (upset, to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble is, you've got no life. Moe KETTLE DRUMS Curly in the stomach.  Curly's leg lashe sending him backward.   MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Curly backs away, squealing, afraid of retaliation.  Reac of the room, Curly trips over the leg of a bookish guest reading a newspaper.  Curly falls to the floor. CURLY (to the guest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me. GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. The guest goes back to reading his paper and crosses his floor, Curly sees the guest's crossed legs and decides to knee. He hits it hard and makes a loud wooden THUMP.  The paper down and stares at Curly who squeals in frustration leg again. Finally, Curly smacks himself in the face a fe CHOPS the leg.  Curly clutches his hand in pain and HOWLS Curly an "it serves you right" nod.  The guest uncrosses BANGS loudly to the floor we realize it is a wooden leg. this, reaches down, and KNOCKS on the wood.  It sounds li at a door, so Curly says: CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Curly pulls the guest's trouser leg up to reveal the actu tiny sign that reads: POST NO BILLS.  Curly rises and bac until he encounters a large white marble statue of a musc a pedestal.  Sort of a cut-rate version of Rodin's The Th the statue's bent leg and contemplates tapping its knee w CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo-oohh. Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Curly taps the statue's knee and -- improbably -- obtains the statue's leg flexes.  In response, an amazed Curly ba the statue. Then pauses to wonder how the statue could ha is, of course, a male model made up to look like a statue Meanwhile, on the other side of the room, Moe, Larry and all bent over, tapping their legs below the knee.  Willia an announcement. WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner is served. Moe straightens up and turns to Larry. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eats! Curly starts GIBBERING like a madman and running in place the sofa.  Larry runs around it and hops on Moe's back fo into the dining room. The guests and Williams watch all t looks while Sherry laughs happily. Finally, Curly runs ov Williams' back for his own piggy-back ride into the dinin SHERRY (laughing, to the stunned guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't they marvelous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone save Williams is seated at the dining room table the head of the table.  On her right sits Moe and Larry ( flirt with the lady on his right, Moe grabs him violently Sherry's left sits Curly.  To Curly's left is the Countes the other end of the table, opposite Sherry.  The seating like this: Sherry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moe                Curly Larry                The Countess Lady                Male Guest ?                Matronly Woman ?                John Rumsford

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a cream puff in front of them.  We know what CURLY (to Sherry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love cream puffs. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I hope you gentlemen will like my Spanish  dinner. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just crazy about Spanish food -- especially  corned beef and cabbage. SHERRY (laughing, to guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he funny?  Ha ha ha! Curly notices the Countess looking around for something. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all the fuss? THE COUNTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I dropped my serviette. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just keep seated. Nobody'll notice it. The Countess gives him a look.  Curly shoots her a look r CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, have half of mine. Curly tears his napkin in half and hands it to the Counte THE COUNTESS (snootily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thenk you. Curly grins, waves and offers a quiet "Nyuk, nyuk."  Then Countess powdering her face with a powder puff.  He squea his pocket, and pulls out an electric razor.  He plugs in (apparently, the socket is built right into the dining ro starts to BUZZ loudly.  Curly starts shaving himself, muc annoyance.  He yelps when he snags a piece of skin just a he reaches over and starts shaving the Countess' face.  S in horror at this. THE COUNTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really! She goes back to powdering her face.  Curly gives her one dismissive waves and goes back to shaving.  Williams appr with a tray. WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biscuit, Madame? THE COUNTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Williams is about to offer Curly a biscuit but is shocked him shaving at the dinner table. WILLIAMS (disapproving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?! CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! WILLIAMS (regains his composure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biscuit, sir? CURLY (rubbing his hands with glee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, soitanly! Curly takes a biscuit and sets to work on it with a knife grimaces in disbelief and moves on. William offers the tr WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biscuit, sir? Moe and Larry manage to take their biscuits without incid two).  While Moe shakes enough salt onto his biscuit to p Columbia film library, Larry makes a sandwich out of his giant stalk of celery.  With both hands, Larry raises the to his mouth and is about to bite into it. MOE (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Where's your Emily Post? Moe's reference to the famous etiquette maven causes Larr pinkies in the air before biting down joyfully on the san impolite CRUNCH.  Moe nods in approval and continues to s Meanwhile, the Countess continues powdering her face. Cur biscuit in two and places one half on the table and start other half. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my favorite dish. Biscuits! Biscuits  all the time. The Countess sets the powder puff down on top of Curly's finishes buttering, picks up the powder puff by mistake, "biscuit" in his mouth.   He tries to bite off a piece but can't.  He makes a face, Countess who now puts on lipstick, gives him a disdainful bites a piece of powder puff, glancing happily at the Cou chew it, going cross-eyed at the effort; swallows some do bite; squeals, earning another look from the Countess; Cu moment ... then abruptly stuffs the biscuit in his mouth another piece.   The Countess sighs and rolls her eyes. Suddenly, Curly st grabs his throat, eyes bulging.  Desperately, he WHACKS t causing face powder to SPEW out of his mouth.  He grabs a off the table and drinks some down.  He turns to look at grimaces.  The Countess is white with powder and totally cracks up at the sight of her. SHERRY (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You funny, funny man! MOE (grimly ironic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Isn't he a scream? Williams serves the tamales, a native Mexican food made o red peppers rolled in cornmeal and wrapped in corn husks. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, I just love tamales in the Spring! CURLY (off his tamale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a funny thing. It don't know whether it's  comin' or goin'. Suspicious, Moe and Larry peer at their tamales, at first cautiously, then POUNDING them.  Curly picks his up, shak GLOOPY sound from its interior, sets it on his plate, and conversation with it. CURLY (to the tamale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to me so I'll know which is the head or  the tail. Curly barks at it twice, then pats it gently as if it wer CURLY (to the tamale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet now, quiet. Nyuk, nyuk. Moe tries to penetrate the corn husk with a spoon, to no MOE (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing can't lick me. Moe tucks his napkin into his collar and starts to manhan Meanwhile, Larry uses a fork and a knife on his tamale wi LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Stubborn, huh? Finally, Curly figures out that you have to unwrap the da happily begins to do so. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Larry butters and salts his and BITES down on it as if it cob.  Moe tries to finger-poke his tamale as if it were C tries to squeeze the life out of it. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get tough with me-- ?! Moe SLAMS it to his plate. Sauce SQUIRTS out of it and bl He tries to wipe it off, only making it worse. MOE (off the tamale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bomb!  An infernal machine! Curly keeps tearing off flakes of husk, finally finding o starts to do the same.  Curly salts his husk and pops it butters one of his own, puts it with another one, and eat He claps his hands together and looks satisfied -- until Then, he pauses to make a face. Curly scrapes sauce off a and grows wild-eyed with anticipation as he salts the hus mouth with it.   Larry, having made no progress, bites into one end of his sauce to STREAM out the other end and blacken Curly's fac wipes his eye. Larry looks in horror at what he's done. CURLY (angry, to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you--! Curly picks up a tamale and threatens to throw it at Larr LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Don't throw it!  Don't throw it!  Larry ducks his head into Moe's lap as Curly throws.  The spatters Moe.  Moe grabs Larry by the hair and pulls him MOE (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, you.  Moe SMACKS Larry on the forehead and turns to Curly. MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you--! Moe picks up a cream puff to throw at Curly. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moe!  Don't! Curly ducks his head into the Countess' lap as Moe throws hits the Countess in the forehead.  Curly pops up. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ducked -- Curly sees the creamed Countess and reacts with horror. desperately tries to maintain an air of dignity. The youn beside her begins to roar with laughter at the sight of h him in his open mouth with a cream puff.  Now, it's Sherr hysterically.  The Male Guest grabs a cream puff and eyes rises, much to her dismay, preparing to hit her with it. THE COUNTESS (also rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no no no no no no... But, at the last second, he throws the cream puff at Sher her square in the face.  Rumsford, sitting at the far end to the guest named John, puts a hand to his head in disma smiling like a kid, winds up and pitches her cream puff a the table, hitting John. Then she grabs Curly's cream puf as he is shouting: RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is outrageous!  I demand that something  be done-- ! Sherry laughs even harder than before, shaking in her cha open. Rumsford grabs a cream puff and somehow throws it r mouth.  John, wiping some cream from his face, accidental the Matronly Woman beside him.  She, in turn, picks up he SMACKS him with it.  They start throwing the rest of thei MOE (to Curly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all your fault, you-- Moe picks up a cream puff.  Curly hides behind the Counte CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woo-woo-woo-woo-woo... Cut it out, Moe! A cream puff hits the Countess. She sputters. Curly pokes behind her. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. He ducks back. Another cream puff hits the Countess.  CURLY (to Moe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed me. The Countess says something defiant but incomprehensible. MOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ehh, that'll teach you! Moe gets hit by a cream puff. An untouched FEMALE GUEST t peace. FEMALE GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks! This must stop! The woman is instantly CLOBBERED by a cream puff.  By now degenerated into anarchy: Sherry, Larry, Moe, Curly and t throw cream puffs or get hit with them or both.  Curly du table and pops up with his napkin covering his head.  Of he peeks out from behind it, he is WHACKED with a cream p CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I surrender! I-- Curly rises, grunts, and gets WHACKED again. CURLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. An unsuspecting Williams calmly enters the room and stare amazement. Everyone is throwing food. WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor York just-- Williams gets hit by a cream puff.  Huffily, he turns to one right in the back of the neck.  He raises his shoulde deeply, and marches out of the room. Rumsford and the Stooges crawl on hands and knees away fr partygoers and confer in a quieter part of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUMSFORD (to the Stooges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I think you'd better leave now while  my wife's still enjoying herself and before she  changes her mind. Believe me, I'm grateful.  (pulls out a wad of cash)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will-will about fifteen hundred do? MOE (taking the whole wad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's just right. Thanks. Rumsford crawls away to join Sherry while the Stooges cou Sherry is having a ball, throwing and being thrown at. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoooo!  Ha ha ha! A smiling Rumsford approaches, carrying a huge chocolate BIRTHDAY on it. SHERRY (happily, off the cake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my birthday cake! Oh, darling, in all my  life I've never had so much fun! Rumsford immediately DUMPS the entire cake on her head. RUMSFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. They stare at each other, she in disbelief and he, inscru hands on his hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
